page.title: 02Lands End Radio Moves Home
page.content: One of the most famous coast radio stations in the world - the Post Offices{Lands End Radio}- has moved home to new premises five miles to the south-west of the site at{St.Just which it has occupied for 66 years.The move means an improved service for seafarers using the station. The transfer to the new site - at {Skewjack,}near{Sennen}- at a cost of Â£92,000,is the latest stage in a continuing programme by the Post Office to modernise and expand its {maritime radio station. The move has been made to provide more space for the{Radio Officers}and their equipment and to prevent the transmitters,which are still at {St.Just}from causing interference to the sensitive receiving equipment at {Skewjack.
